DataElement.preferredName: Specimen Cell-free Circulating Tumor DNA Assay Tumor Tissue Submission Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The yes/no indicate whether or not any cell-free circulating tumor DNA assay tumor specimens were submitted.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Specimen Cell-free Circulating Tumor DNA Assay Tumor Tissue Submission
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A part of a thing, or of several things, taken to demonstrate or to determine the character of the whole, e.g. a substance, or portion of material obtained for use in testing, examination, or study; particularly, a preparation of tissue or bodily fluid taken for examination or diagnosis.:An assay that is used to detect cell-free circulating tumor DNA for the identification of molecular residual disease and the assessment of treatment response or progression in patients with solid tumors._A tumor sample, or entire tumor that is removed for microscopic examination._Something submitted for the judgment or consideration of others.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Specimen; a bit of tissue or blood or urine that is taken or used for research purposes.

Concepts.definition: A part of a thing, or of several things, taken to demonstrate or to determine the character of the whole, e.g. a substance, or portion of material obtained for use in testing, examination, or study; particularly, a preparation of tissue or bodily fluid taken for examination or diagnosis.

Property.preferredName: Cell-free Circulating Tumor DNA Assay Tumor Tissue Submission
Property.preferredDefinition: An assay that is used to detect cell-free circulating tumor DNA for the identification of molecular residual disease and the assessment of treatment response or progression in patients with solid tumors._A tumor sample, or entire tumor that is removed for microscopic examination._Something submitted for the judgment or consideration of others.

Concepts.definition: An assay that is used to detect cell-free circulating tumor DNA for the identification of molecular residual disease and the assessment of treatment response or progression in patients with solid tumors.

Tissue sample that contains an abnormal cellular infiltrate forming a solid mass. The abnormal cellular component can be benign or malignant. Tumor samples are obtained for microscopic examination and/or molecular analysis.
Something submitted for the judgment or consideration of others.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: attributes of a patient's laboratory sample, including the source, condition, and fixative.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.
